Package com.txtsoft.txttrafficanalyzer

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
com.txtsoft.txttrafficanalyzer.Utils
public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
Class contains some static members for general purpose. The members have supporting functionality.
Author:
mb

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) static java.lang.Boolean bWin
    Member stores, whether application runs on Windows (value "true") or not, what means Linux is assumed (value false).
    (package private) static java.lang.String sDelimiter
    Member stores suitable file path delimiter for Windows ("\") or Linux ("/").

  • Method Details

    • loadText

      public static java.lang.String loadText​(java.io.File f)
      Loads an UTF-8 text file from disk. Gives out exceptions in case file does not exist or cannot be read from. If file content begins with byte -1 as shown in IDE debug process (-17 as byte data type) and then byte -2 as shown in IDE debug process (-69 as byte data type), only the begin of file's content will be indicated therewith, so these bytes are removed from the beginning of returned value.
      Parameters:
      f - file object to be loaded as text
      Returns:
      content String of file handed over as parameter

    • loadString

      public static java.lang.String loadString​(java.lang.String absoluteOrRelativePathSeenFromMainJar)
      Loads text from disk using UTF-8 coding.
      Parameters:
      absoluteOrRelativePathSeenFromMainJar - file name including absolute or relative path seen from application main directory
      Returns:
      String object of text loaded

    • fActiveJarPathWithoutFilename

      public static java.io.File fActiveJarPathWithoutFilename()
      Path for related JAR-file, i.e. Java program currently executed, is determined and stored in a new file object. This path does not include the JAR-file name. Works correctly under Windows and Linux. Path can contain spaces. Procedure also works, when called in Preloader thread.
      Returns:
      new file object with working program's path. For Windows for example: /E:/PRJ EC/sc/bin/; for Linux for example: /home/mb/Downloads/_200802 sc dist Linux
